course_description: Geology and paleontology are essential sciences for understanding how the earth, its life, and environments changed through time. This class explores their 18th and 19th century roots by reading, discussing, and writing about books of those times to learn appreciation for their scientific influence.
prerequisites: ENVS 120 or ENVS 130 or ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or ENVS 140 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location: MW 10am-11:15am in Math & Science Center - W502
sections: Class Nbr: 2840, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: A. Martin, Status: Open
